page.title: 03Customs in Chalton
page.content: {Weather Sayings:}When storm clouds approach from the South,Chalton people say: "It's raining from William's mother. "This might be a reference to the mother of William the Conqueror. She lived in Normandy. {SUPERSTITIONS:}If you see a magpie you should spit over your finger to avert bad luck.{SUPERNATURAL:}There are five stories. One says a horesman rides on Chalton Down.Another tells of a hunter who chased a white fox into a house by the Red Lion. The hunter found no fox but a fair haired woman breathing heavily. Another tells of an invisible hand sweeping objects off the mantelpiece at Chalton Priory. At the same time,a picture fell off the wall. The wires holding it up appeared to have been cut. At the Priory dinner party, a guest mistook a figure in a nun's habit for a maid.
